title: Calories in Scallops
meta_description: Discover calories in scallops per 100 g serving, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown for easy meal planning.
assumptions: Sea scallops, steamed or seared, no added butter/oil/salt; values for cooked weight.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by scallop type (bay vs. sea), size, freshness, cooking method, and added ingredients. Check labels or sources when available.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of cooked scallops provide ~111 kcal and ~20.5 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Saut√©ed in 1 tsp butter per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g of scallops?
faqs.a: About 111 kcal for cooked sea scallops.
Yes, ~20.5 g protein per 100 g, making them a lean seafood option.
They contain ~5.4 g carbs per 100 g, mostly from natural glycogen.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in scallops?
faqs.a: Low at ~0.8 g total fat per 100 g, with minimal saturated fat.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in scallops?
faqs.a: Minimal change if steamed; frying or butter adds 30-50 kcal per 100 g.
